headline: I build software that works, tools that solve problems, and teams that execute with confidence
summary:
I excel at building high functioning teams, designing robust system architectures, and launching products from MVP to successive releases. I am versatile, able to take on the roles of CTO, Software Architect, or Principal Engineer. I help bridge the gap between engineering leadership and individual contributors.

I lead by example to set high standards for code quality, technology adoption, platform security, and automation. My extensive knowledge of computing technology and passion for well-crafted products serves to inspire colleagues and mentor junior staff.

I am committed to open channels of communication between engineering, product, and business teams, to improve product quality and business efficiency. I strive to be at the nexus of product, project, and business-critical information flows.

experiences.title: Principal Architect
experiences.description:
• Led the adoption of gRPC/Protobuf for contract based service design as part of a migration from Java to Go/Python based monolith-to-microservice rebuild.
• Worked with Devops to revise and improve scale, cost, and observability of AWS platform deployment.
• Designed and co-developed a user activity fraud detection and forensic review platform using ML (Python, scikit-learn).
• Evaluated and advised on key 3rd party integrations for consumer banking products, infosec, and devops.
• Established architecture review process and decision record documentation system.
• Worked with business verticals to best Domain Driven Design practices, particularly Ubiquitous Language and Bounded Contexts.
• Mentored staff and established new documentation standards for RFCs, TDDs and ADRs.
• Established a “Staff Engineering” career track and mentored Sr Eng candidates towards Principal Engineer career goals.
• Led a team of direct PE reports.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.description:
• Rebuilt Slated’s engineering team after NYC to LA relocation.
• Refactored AWS cloud implementation for scale, rewrote CI/CD, established branch/environment based promotion to production process.
• Built offshore team to increase delivery velocity.
• Refactored backend through multiple versions of Python and Django.
• Built film analytics ML pipeline including scrapers, ETL, and normalization for analytics.

experiences.title: Director of Software Engineering
experiences.description:
• Rebuilt and ran Apposite’s network test equipment e2e validation system.
• Migrated code management from svn to git, updated build systems.

experiences.title: Software Architect
experiences.description:
•	Developed features and debugged performance in Python & C++ for a "P2P Dropbox" product
•	Designed and developed RESTful web api using CherryPy (but wish I was using django_rest_framework)
•	Built highly scaled test automation system for LAN and WAN performance+load test using VirtualBox, VMWare and EC2 infrastructure and APIs
•	Helped define management, SCM and release process based on Scrum for Cloudpic's distributed telecommute engineering environment
•	Designed, implemented and packaged Python toolkits for use with various web APIs

experiences.title: Software Lead
experiences.description:
•	Architected and implemented FastSoft’s SNMP service using Net-Snmp and OpenNMS.
•	Developed/shipped custom MIB and wrote SNMP agent for E-Series network accelerator.
•	Diagnosed TCP CWND behavior for FAST (http://netlab.caltech.edu/FAST). Profiled BSD kernel mbufs (packet storage) for increased 10gig TCP throughput.

experiences.title: Consulting Software Engineer
experiences.description:
Contract software R&D, technology valuation, and project assessments. Key technologies are:
•	Python, Django, including web, DBMS, NoSQL, data science and machine learning applications
•	Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Redis, and RabbitMQ for search, data schema design, high performance caching and async processing
•	Angular and Ionic for web and mobile UX; top-level use case modelling and site architecture
•	Web and email operations setup, maintenance, and network security
•	Linux and Linux cloud platform systems engineering and applications: Ubuntu, bash & Linux CLI tools, C/C++, etc. on AWS, Digital Ocean and others
•	Agile and Scrum base software development workflows and toolchains

experiences.title: Software Development Consultant
experiences.description:
•	Developed ClickMix (MP3 player/mixer app) through two major and several minor releases (C++ & WxWidgets on Windows & MacOS).
•	Extended Rssbandit (RSS feed reader) for multi-string scanning and display of RSS feeds.  Used 3rd party WinForms widgets from www.glacialcomponents.com and www.divil.co.uk/net
•	Wrote C#/ASP.NET code to extend features of www.realenergy.com and www.eurorient.com.
•	Implemented rewrite of www.remeyewear.com website in PHP on LAMP to customer spec.

experiences.title: Principal Engineer
experiences.description:
•	Architected C++/C# SDK for Vling/MindSpring “skype-like” softphone. Lead dev team through several release cycles; worked with Product to set business & technical goals. Mindspring achieved 100k+ distribution. 
•	Consulted to Muni-WiFi division on location detection algorithms for IP & WiFi-triangulated geo targeting/local search. Investigated Akamai and SkyHook Wireless technologies. Worked with SkyHook SDK..
•	Designed prototype XMPP presence service for Helio mobile phones using Djabberd.
•	Lead tech team transitioning PeoplePC engineering from San Francisco to Pasadena. Documented system architecture and processes. Oversaw knowledge transfer assignments.
•	Re-engineered PeoplePC lifecycle process using Jira. Built workflow and role based assignment and notification site. Trained engineering and product staff.
•	Analyzed and planned Earthlink-wide future Akamai usage. Recommended $250k per year savings by reducing in contract minumum.

experiences.title: VP Engineering
experiences.description:
• Led software development team and product deployment process. 
• Introduced Agile/Scrum best practices, code reviews, release management, test automation and regression test.
• Scaled high volume production email system peered into multiple backbones.

experiences.title: Manager, IxOS Product Development
experiences.description:
• Established the IxOS core platform team.
• Designed a software quality process for zero known defect releases.
• Led security hardening user facing of Windows device management application

accomplishment_patents.title: A TECHNIQUE FOR ENHANCING CLICK-DRAG OPERATIONS IN USER INTERFACES"
Efficient large scale broadcasting on local area Networks served by high speed terrestrial or satellite communication links

accomplishment_projects.title: FastAPI Search Cookiecutter
accomplishment_projects.description:
What’s fapi?

Many times I’ve needed a SQL plus NOSQL/Search microservice backend and have spun up several now, including Django+Postgres+Solar, Flask+Algolia, and other combinations. The one I plan to use next is FastAPI + Elasticsearch (or the Amazonian Opensearch alternative.)

Instead of waiting and building yet another one-off codebase under time pressure, I’m standardizing this micro-stack ahead of time. With time to go deep with the architecture, I can bolt in best practices that often get left on the cutting room floor, such as

- Fully normalized formatting and linting
- Full use of Python async on the frontside (APIs) and the backside (search and RDBMS requests)
- A code layout that standardizes versioned APIs, CLI commands, background tasks, and built-in OpenAPI/Swagger support
- A standard test methodology that includes mock driven unit tests and full stack data tests
- Well built Docker support, including a tight production image and docker compose support for fully functional instant infrastructure
- Scripts for 1 liner builds, lints, and test runs

What would I use this for?

Launching your next awesome scalable search service or fast lookup microservice.

recommendations:
Barry Mulling



I consider Rod to be one of my biggest role models in the business. Working with Rod taught me a great deal about how to think about large-scale engineering problems, how to implement them, and how to promote a healthy, vibrant engineering culture. He enthusiastically shared his knowledge and skills and made everyone who worked with him better engineers and technologists. He has enough in-depth knowledge and experience to have strong opinions, but with a sense of practicality and balance that ensures that the perfect isn't the enemy of the good. If I'm half as good as Rod ten years from now I'll consider myself a raging success.

Rudi Cilibrasi



Rod Morison achieves the rare combination of technical brilliance and
inspirational management style.  He is able to code with ingenuity in
all the languages his team needs, and can thus pick up the slack
wherever his team needs help without overextending himself.  But he is
also able to delegate effectively, utilizing the special capability of
each of his reports to the fullest extent and according to their
working style.  He is efficient with self-managing developers yet
provides ample direction for those that need more guidance.  He is
perfectly comfortable designing great software architecture and
utilizing the latest scientific literature for complex algorithm
development.  He does all this within the context of critical business
priorities and schedules and his track record shows it.  You can rely
on Rod to build and manage a team to get the job done right.

Tom Longson



Rod is a good manager, not only because he knows how to keep a team moving forward, but also isn't afraid to get his hands dirty and dig into serious codebase. I only worked under Rod for a brief period, but I appreciated his professionalism and believe he is a strong asset to any tech shop.

Diego Dugatkin



Rod did a great job at Ixia, successfully managing the development of the highly complex IxOS operating system and its directly associated products.  His ability to communicate clearly, together with very strong technical and organizational skills were essential for the several product releases during Rod's tenure.
Rod's breath and depth are a true asset for any engineering organization.

Myron A.



Rod is a smart manager, very techically capable and a pleasure to work with.  We had many great brainstorming sessions to improve the product, and Rod always had good ideas. I'd highly recommend Rod for either a software development management/executive position or a hands-on development position.

Bo Adler



Rod did an amazing job at bringing to life what seemed like an impossible task!  Pulling together developers from across the country, he worked with each one on the hurdles of how the technology might work.  Final integration of our pieces was a breeze as well, a credit to Rod's involvement at just the right level to keep things moving at a brisk pace.
